comments.body: I think it would be helpful to point out which classes these refer to
Would it? I kind of wanted to leave that a bit vague here so that people can get the general shape of the hierarchy before worrying about memorizing names. Maybe that's a bad idea though.
Hmm then maybe it's not worth including this list at all, and just point directly to the Cats hierarchy?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@Beyond the above, certain capabilities are *assumed* by Cats Effect but defined elsewhere (or rather, defined within [Cats](https://typelevel.org/cats)). Non-exhaustively, those capabilities are as follows:

- Transforming the value inside an effect by `map`ping over it
- Putting a value *into* an effect
- Composing multiple effectful computations together sequentially, such that each is dependent on the previous

comments.body: Yes. Perhaps that should be pointed out explicitly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +93,97 @@The `inner` poll eliminates the inner `uncancelable`, but the *outer* `uncancelable` still applies, meaning that this whole thing is equivalent to `MonadCancel[F].uncancelable(_ => fa)`.

Note that polling for an *outer* block within an inner one has no effect whatsoever. For example:
